--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, stack <stack@a...> wrote:
> Robin Wu wrote:
> 
> > Hi,
> >  
> > I download heritrix-1.0.0 source released on Augest 6th, and 
build it 
> > with maven 1.0, IBM Java SDK 1.4.2 on Windows XP.  But get some 
errors 
> > when testing.
> >  
> > here're parts of the log.
> >
> The below junit test failures look like "2.3. [ 984390 ] Build 
fails: 
> 'rws' mode and Mac OS X interact badly" in Known Limitations (See 
> http://crawler.archive.org/articles/limitations.html).  Try the 
> suggested workaround.

the error seems different in my case. following is the details in 
test-report.
==================
Testsuite: org.archive.util.DiskStackTest
Tests run: 3, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Time elapsed: 0.141 sec

Testcase: testCtorBadFile(org.archive.util.DiskStackTest): FAILED
no exception on bad file
junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: no exception on bad file

> 
> FYI: None of the junit tests have network dependencies.
> 
> To make heritrix crawl via a proxy, you do not need to edit code.  
In 
> the settings screen, if you have advanced settings enabled, you'll 
see 
> two text boxes in the FetchHTTP section: One is for the proxy 
hostname 
> and the other for proxy port.
>
